Package net.nextinfinity.core.player

Interface PlayerHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CorePlayerHandler

    public interface PlayerHandler
    The PlayerHandler object manages the GamePlayer objects for online Bukkit players.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      GamePlayer getPlayer​(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Obtains the GamePlayer object for the specified Bukkit entity.
      GamePlayer loadPlayer​(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Loads a GamePlayer object for the specified Bukkit entity.
      void setPlayerClass​(java.lang.Class<? extends GamePlayer> playerClass)
      Alters the Java class to be used for players, in case a game wishes to use a custom player class.
      void unloadPlayer​(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Unloads the GamePlayer object for the specified Bukkit entity.

    • Method Detail

      • loadPlayer

        GamePlayer loadPlayer​(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Loads a GamePlayer object for the specified Bukkit entity. This should only be called on entity join.
        Parameters:
        player - the Bukkit entity to load a GamePlayer object for
        Returns:
        the loaded GamePlayer

      • unloadPlayer

        void unloadPlayer​(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Unloads the GamePlayer object for the specified Bukkit entity. This should only be called on entity disconnect.
        Parameters:
        player - the Bukkit entity to unload the GamePlayer object for

      • getPlayer

        GamePlayer getPlayer​(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Obtains the GamePlayer object for the specified Bukkit entity.
        Parameters:
        player - the Bukkit entity to obtain the GamePlayer object for
        Returns:
        the GamePlayer object

      • setPlayerClass

        void setPlayerClass​(java.lang.Class<? extends GamePlayer> playerClass)
        Alters the Java class to be used for players, in case a game wishes to use a custom player class. The new class must implement GamePlayer. It may be helpful for custom player classes to extend CoreGamePlayer, as this implements all necessary functions.
        Parameters:
        playerClass - the new Java class to use for players
        See Also:
        CoreGamePlayer
